New Records: Kwadwo Duah scored the first goal of the match in his second appearance for Switzerland
Breel Embolo scored the final goal in stoppage time, sealing the win for Switzerland
Key Match Events: Kwadwo Duah opened the scoring with a beautifully timed run and finish
Michel Aebischer scored a beautiful curling effort from 23 yards out to make it 2-0 to Switzerland
Barnabas Varga headed home from a couple of yards out to make it 1-2 to Switzerland
Breel Embolo sealed the win for Switzerland with a lifted finish over Peter Gulacsi's head in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary were fancied by many as one of the dark horses given their impressive unbeaten run in qualifying, but they looked off the pace against Switzerland
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Clarke was frustrated by Scotland's mauling by Germany at Euro 2024, saying 'we let ourselves down'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win puts Switzerland level on points with hosts Germany in Group A, with Hungary and Scotland propping up the standings
Michel Aebischer's display in the first half was incredible, creating several chances from midfield and assisting Duah for the first goal
Others: The match was played at Euro 2024, with Switzerland beating Hungary 3-1 in Group A
